skill.name: designing-frontend
skill.description: Build distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with memorable aesthetics. Use when creating web components, pages, or applications. Prioritizes creative, context-specific design over generic patterns.
skill.summary: Build distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with memorable aesthetics. Use when creating...
skill.author: Byunk

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown design guidelines. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands. Completely safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Generic-looking interfaces fail to capture user attention and dilute brand identity. This skill guides AI assistants to create bold, memorable frontend designs with unique aesthetics, strong visual hierarchy, and production-ready code quality.
actual_capabilities: Creates production-grade frontend code (HTML/CSS, React, Vue)
Applies distinctive aesthetics (typography, color, motion, spatial composition)
Follows a structured workflow: conceptualize, implement, verify, iterate
Avoids generic patterns and clichÃ©d design choices
Implements accessibility validation and visual hierarchy checks
limitations: Does not generate design mockups or visual assets
Does not test code in live browsers
Does not integrate with design tools like Figma or Sketch
Does not provide design system documentation

use_cases.title: Build memorable web interfaces
use_cases.description: Create unique, production-ready user interfaces that stand out from generic templates and patterns.

use_cases.title: Transform concepts into code
use_cases.description: Translate design vision into clean, accessible frontend code with distinctive visual identity.

use_cases.title: Add visual impact to projects
use_cases.description: Elevate web applications with bold aesthetics, thoughtful motion, and cohesive design language.

prompt_templates.title: Simple component request
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a [button/card/modal] component with a [brutalist/minimalist/retro] aesthetic. Include hover states and accessibility.

prompt_templates.title: Page with specific theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a landing page for [product type] with a [luxury/organic/tech] theme. Use distinctive typography and cohesive color palette.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive element
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an interactive [navigation/modal/gallery] with staggered animations, scroll-triggered effects, and smooth transitions.

prompt_templates.title: Full design system
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complete [dashboard/application/landing] with a unique [aesthetic direction]. Include responsive layout, typography system, color variables, motion guidelines, and all core components. Verify accessibility compliance.

best_practices: Specify the aesthetic direction upfront (brutalist, maximalist, organic) to guide all design decisions
Include technical constraints (framework, performance budget, accessibility requirements) in your request
Iterate progressively - start with core layout, then add motion and visual effects
Request verification of accessibility compliance (keyboard navigation, screen reader support)
anti_patterns: Using generic aesthetic choices (Inter font, purple gradients, centered layouts)
Overlooking accessibility in favor of visual impact
Converging on familiar patterns instead of pushing for distinctiveness
Ignoring performance implications of heavy animations or effects

faq.question: Which frontend frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Works with React, Vue, HTML/CSS/JS, and other modern frameworks. Specify your framework in the prompt.

faq.question: What design aesthetics are available?
faq.answer: Supports brutalist, minimalist, maximalist, retro-futuristic, organic, luxury, brutalist, and custom mixed aesthetics.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing code?
faq.answer: Generate components that follow your project's patterns. Provide existing code context for better integration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why do my designs look generic sometimes?
faq.answer: Specify bold aesthetic direction and request distinctive typography. Avoid generic choices like Inter font or centered layouts.

faq.question: How is this different from standard code generation?
faq.answer: Prioritizes unique visual identity over generic patterns. Focuses on typography, motion, spatial composition, and memorable aesthetics.
